newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAFRICA NOON STOCKS CONTINUE WEAKER IN QUIET TRADE.
newsitem.headline: SAFRICA NOON STOCKS CONTINUE WEAKER IN QUIET TRADE.

text.p: 1030 GMT - South African noon industrials weaker as market players digest expectations of disappointing results later from some of the market's key companies, dealers say.
Golds also weaker despite bullion's recovery. Bullion last bid at $347.10. Overall volumes moderate with 400 million rand worth of shares traded so far.
Underlying sentiment positive, but nervousness seen creeping into industrials in afternoon.
* Industrial giant, SAB sheds 425 cents to 129.00 rand ahead of its year results later, Didata up five cents to 15.45 rand following a book-over buy of 2.5 million shares, worth 38 million rand.
* Golds lose 11.0 points to 1,256.8, industrials down 11.7 points to 8,464.4 and all-shares shed 12.0 points to 7,178.3.
